author: Alex Michaelides
review: A gripping psychological thriller that keeps you on the edge of your seat. The twists and turns will leave you questioning everything.

author: Delia Owens
review: A beautiful and haunting story of loneliness, love, and survival in the wilds of North Carolina. A must-read for fans of literary fiction.

author: Matt Haig
review: A thought-provoking story about regrets and the infinite possibilities of life. The characters are deeply relatable, and the premise is fascinating.

author: Tara Westover
review: An inspiring memoir of a woman who grows up in a strict and abusive household, eventually finding a path to education and self-discovery.

author: James Clear
review: A practical guide to building good habits and breaking bad ones. Clear offers actionable advice supported by scientific research.

author: Markus Zusak
review: A moving story set in Nazi Germany, narrated by Death. A tale of love, loss, and the power of words.
